intro: Pedicularis roborowskii, commonly known as the Siberian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its unique morphology includes a slender stem and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
